text: The intestinal micro flora of dogs and cats is a complex and poorly understood population. The poor understanding of what truly constitutes normal versus abnormal, along with the ability to only superficially characterize the gut microbial population, limits understanding of the pathophysiology of enteritis [5] . There is a growing body of evidence indicating bacterial translocation due to impaired gastrointestinal function, leading to the septicemia in young puppies [6] . This supports the use of antibiotics in the treatment protocol of the affected animals.
